name: good hot
description: architectural saunas in a dope location run by some of my favorite people, Lou & Cooper. go with time on a beautiful day /or a shitty one with friends /or alone. v low key. don't go without jumping in the bay, though i love their shower *so much* and want it for myself. every time i go i tell myself i need to come here more often.
pro tip: bring some fancy face cream and a pint or two of cold raspberries.

name: sailing goat
description: the food: honestly mid. the vibes: drunk uncle while he's still fun. open air seating in a covered patio on the water. feels local to the house boat community it neighbors.
tags: restaurant, better vibes than food, seafood, cool space
pro tip: get the fish and chips, sure, but don't come too hungry. come for beers and blackberry picking on the side of road on the drive down into the marina.

name: wildcat canyon
description: my favorite east bay hills walk despite the lack of redwoods. particularly beautiful in spring when the grass is greenest.
pro tip: pick a route that gets vertical quickly and stay up on the ridge line.

name: bull valley roadhouse
description: dark pre‑prohibition vibes in this port costa relic. classy cocktails & family‑style comfort food.
address: 14 Canyon Lake Dr, Port Costa, CA 94569
pro tip: this didn't quite make the list, but go get drunk at the warehouse cafe across the street after you've spent enough $$.

name: tortilleria el molino
description: fresh tortillas & legit mexican plates in the burbs. chile relleno fridays are a sleeper hit. if ever you're in concord, this is the spot.

name: banter
description: the gem of el cerrito. one of the east bay's best wine lists at a price tag that actually feels fair. big wall of bottles & perfect, unpretentious bites to match. devin will make you want to start collecting vhs after a visit.
address: 10368 San Pablo Ave, El Cerrito, CA 94530
pro tip: find claire who runs the place and stocks the wall and who will take you exactly where you need to go.

name: mel-o-dee
description: the east bay's premiere strip mall dive bar. strong drinks & haunted-by-a-friendly-ghost vibes.
address: 240 El Cerrito Plaza, El Cerrito, CA 94530

name: 99 ranch
description: pan‑asian grocery wonderland – live seafood, durian, & aisles of imported snacks.

name: hotsy totsy club
description: the best cocktails out of any dive bar out there. camp out on the shuffleboard table and zone out to vintage soft core porn.
pro tip: they let you bring your food from the taco truck in the parking lot (el autolense) inside.

name: tacos el autlense
description: the best burrito (carnitas, always) in albany, but *perhaps* even the entire east bay. lengua tacos also hit or a chicken burrito if you're feeling healthy af. cash only. eat inside hotsy totsy next door with a cocktail.
pro tip: if it's not the height of the dinner rush, you can place your order ahead of time via phone.

name: stuff
description: 9000sqft modern eclectic antique warehouse. furniture rotates often. can be hit or miss, but deals are easy to come by.

name: albany sauna & tubs
description: bare(ish)bones finnish saunas & outdoor hot tubs. low-key dope products store up front. heat, soak, feel human.

name: wojia hunan cuisine
description: a big ass, smackin' ass menu with not a lot of misses. best for a big group — only because you get to try more. better food than vibes, but i love dining there for that reason.
tags: chinese, big group, restaurant, the spot
pro tip: "eggplant with grind peppers" is THE best dish in the east bay.

name: saigon seafood harbor
description: dim sum & cantonese seafood classics -- carts loaded with dumplings & crab. come with a big group.
pro tip: "special lobster e fu noodles" = slurp slurp.

name: flowerland
description: urban oasis/nursery + hirewire coffee hut. good place to go alone if you need some space (in public).
pro tip: snag one of the heated chairs with your coffee. if that's taken, there are many hidden seating areas throughout the land of flowers.

name: korean superette
description: cozy korean market & café; banchan, bulgogi bowls & spicy rice cakes to go. i like eating warm soup in the back when winter brings rain.

name: of all places
description: u *could* get stoned and come in for an ~~unrivaled~~ selection of perfect little munchies. or begin a hot picnic date here. or take a child for "one" special treat. the most smackin' snack shop out there.
pro tip: find joe or celia (our snack curators/the best ppl) and describe exactly what you're up to. let them excise your munchie demons.

name: pegasus books
description: new & used bookstore. pegasus has a few locations in the east bay, but i've found this one to have the best selection of used art, architecture, and cookbooks.

name: cragmont rock
description: pocket-sized rock park with bay views. picnic tables and views. catch me at the hoop.

name: hella bagels
description: hand‑rolled bagels made by a dope east bay local. the east bay bagel scene has become decently legit -- blake is putting out the best flavor combinations.
pro tip: you should probably preorder.

name: lulu
description: très lovely california take on palestinian cuisine. a personal favorite brunch spot — though tbh I haven't been for din, yet. chef mona is, herself, a pearl.
pro tip: the shukaquiles hit equally hard hungover or not.

name: pâtisserie rotha
description: french pastry as perfect as you're going get in the east bay.
pro tip: get there close to opening: the good shit sells out fast.

name: tokyo fish market
description: specialty japanese market with sushi‑grade fish, produce, deli bentos & a sick gift shop.

name: fieldwork brewing company
description: torched? maybe. cool? no. still some of the best beer around? yup. for those of you who want to escape into the crowd for a moment or anyone with kids. catch me drawing w crayons.
pro tip: the detroit-style pizza low-key smacks.

name: hammerling wines
description: u want ecologically-sound wine made by someone who actually knows what they're doing? (shots fired at a lot of y'all). calling it now, josh will go down as one of the best winemakers in california of our time. the supreme ruler of sparkling.
tags: winery, wine, cool space, the spot
pro tip: many of those bottles will age well.

name: broc cellars
description: an og of the california natural wine movement. although the brand has blown up, quality has remained high. no vinegar water here. not california's most complex wines, but they're consistently delicious.
pro tip: if you want to spend a based day in berkeley, spend the day in the neighborhood getting drunk here and neighboring urban wineries.

name: hida tools
description: i'm a tool junkie as well as a nice things junkie, but - more than anything - a sucker for a high quality japanese knife. hida has all of these things. the spot to buy a personal gift for a friend who uses their body.
pro tip: highest trust knife sharpening in the east bay.

name: monterey market
description: if a farmers' market had a brick and mortar. not quite berkeley bowl in size and diversity of finds, but higher quality -- at least across the produce aisle(s).
pro tip: quadruple the amount of fresh herbs you cook with.

name: monterey fish market
description: high quality, mostly local fish. the place to get fish.

name: fava
description: best lunch in the "gourmet ghetto" (your name, alice, not mine) no questions asked. served out of a tiny window. i would suggest menu items, but the whole thing's fire. mostly to-go/sidewalk seating.
tags: restaurant, sidewalk seats, middle eastern, the spot, lunch
pro tip: grab a bottle of pouilly fuissé across the street at vintage berkeley and head up the hill to the rose garden at cordirnices for a picnic under the pergola.

name: aftel archive of curious scents
description: part museum/part store/part scent consultancy, the aftel archive is the life work of fragrance jedi master mandy aftel. get tickets in advance and give this small museum its due time.
pro tip: mandy's books will change your life if you enjoy spending time in the kitchen.

name: east bay vivarium
description: i'm not a snake guy, i hate spiders, & honestly i'm creeped out by animals in cages. that said, the it's the creepy factor alone the brings me in here every time I drag myself to fourth street — a destination that generally confirms to out-of-town friends that i live in the suburbs.
address: 1827 Fifth St Suite C, Berkeley, CA 94710
pro tip: take a kid here if the oakland zoo feels too far away.

name: standard & strange
description: clothes, such beautiful clothes. mostly men's, but not exclusively. one of their three brick in mortars — the others found in new york and santa fe. special garments from around the world with a strong emphasis on japan + europe + usa.
pro tip: these folks embody the "buy fewer, better things". if you buy a piece that doesn't fit right or gets damaged in some way, take it in and they'll help you hem/patch it up. .

name: bows and arrows
description: so many mensware designers that I crush on live on the rack here. clothes, shoes, pants, bags, accessories, etc. jerry is a world-class curator who's shop would be a destination in any city on any planet.
pro tip: send me money to shop here, pls.

name: ali golden
description: women's clothing selection unmatched anywhere close to here. in house label + curated racks defined both by class and levity. independent, sustainable classics that last.
pro tip: grab a bottle of cowboy grass for your boo if/when you drop $$z here.

name: cultured pickle shop
description: i bow down to these pros. rare on this side of the world is the family who commits themselves to their niche with such passion. simplicity: perfect pickles and ferments.
pro tip: their "rice and pickles" meal *is* the most underrated lunch in the bay (wknds only).

name: viks chaat
description: cafeteria‑style Indian street‑food mecca; chaat, dosas & biryanis served fast. family‑run for 25+ years.

name: berkeley bowl west
description: istanbul has the grand bazaar, bangkok has or tor kor, the east bay has berkeley bowl. there is no better "supermarket" in the world than berkeley bowl -- I stand by that. i take people visiting from out of town to see berkely bowl. sister outpost of Berkeley’s original market, only bigger. warehouse‑sized aisles overflowing with exotic fruits, veggies & bulk goods. hard to not find what you need here.

name: good to eat
description: the whole menu is fire. women/queer‑owned taiwanese spot with a daily rotating seasonal menu. fine‑dining techniques purchased at the counter.

name: berkeley bowl
description: you thought i wasn't going to put bb on this?! iconic independent grocery store & produce paradise.

name: slash denim
description: denim shrine since '79. carla & crew fit you into the perfect pair of vintage levi’s or new jeans. old‑school service & raw selvedge.
tags: store, clothes, men's clothes, women's clothes, vintage, the spot

name: fournée bakery
description: tiny french bakery to hit before a hike in the hills. worth the inevitable line.

name: pretty penny
description: vintage & modern clothing shop with salon vibes. curated threads from the 1920s–70s, buy/sell/trade and maybe get your hair done upstairs.

name: south berkeley farmers' market
description: every east bay chef's favorite farmer's market. tuesday afternoons on adeline & 63rd. the best farms, not a ton of fluff.

name: redfield cider
description: petite cider bar & bottle shop in rockridge. flights of craft ciders, natural wines & beers with snacks. welcoming, kid‑friendly parklet.
pro tip: olivia and mike know more about apples than anyone you've ever met, guaranteed. ask them anything and be amazed.

name: bad walter's bootleg ice cream
description: garage-born ice cream shop turned legit. sydney is a mad-genious//the millenial ben & jerry. scratch‑made, maximalist flavors rotate weekly.
pro tip: her ice cream is low lactose, for those of us who need that.

name: ain't normal cafe
description: rockridge coffee watchtower turned café. showcase of domestic & international roasters, natural wine & beer plus creative dishes.

name: mercy vintage
description: high‑end vintage consignment boutique. mostly women's clothes. curated designer pieces & finds for everyone. buy, sell, trade.

name: sobu
description: independently made warm/modern furniture + home decor. cohesive influence from laleh & alessandro's iranian & italian roots. everything feels as sturdy as it is styled.

name: oakland tool lending library
description: free library with 5k+ tools for home & garden. borrow saws, drills & do it yourself with an oakland ID.

name: snail bar
description: natural wine bar with michellin-level small plates. andres can cook, but he's passing the place off in a bit (to very capable hands). the whole spot has an eye on good art.

name: understory shop
description: temescal alley boutique pushing gorpy high fashion. wes has an eye for spotting designers not yet on the radar. clothes, shoes, zines, crystal balls. my favorite place to buy clothes in the east bay, hands down.
tags: shop, clothes, men's clothes, the spot

name: rose's taproom
description: the orignal softcore pink taproom full of ever-more monsteras. crisp beers and simple snacks. many a first date.

name: rose pizzeria
description: downtown berkeley spot for thin-crust pies & natural wines. they recently opened up a cafe, i haven't tried it yet lol.

name: forma bakery
description: cobalt father/son-run bakery blending french technique & mexican flavors, successfully. the bakery temescal always needed. espresso drinks are the best in temescal.
address: 4920 Telegraph Ave ste a, Oakland, CA 94609

name: game on
description: a bunch of dads got together and built and interactive game lounge with custom puzzle rooms & physical challenges. as fun as it sounds for the nerdos out there. inspired by boda borg in boston.
pro tip: they sell beer.

name: burdell
description: nostalgic soul food reinvented through the lens of fine dining. geoff is as sweet as he is talented -- it's very clear how much love has been poured into this space.

name: root'd
description: only dispensary i'm including on this list, because it's simply the best. craft weed & community emphasis.

name: daytrip counter
description: everything you could possibly want a salad to be plus truly juuuuuicy chicken. daytrip (original) was a fermentation-driven party of a restaurant and i miss it, but i can afford to eat daytrip counter all the time and that's dope. it over delivers. smash for sure.
tags: restaurant, wine, beer, healthy, the spot, lunch, cool space, salad, to-go, sidewalk seating
pro tip: (they deliver). my order: club med salad w double chicken & off menu cup of bone broth ;)

name: tallboy
description: martini dive bar slinging vegan 'tinis & weenies'. high spirits and low pretension. den is a wizard of good times.
tags: bar, cocktails, the spot, cool space, hot dogs

name: temescal brewing
description: lively beer garden & brewery. consistently high quality beer.

name: ok's deli
description: deli throwing Korean-American-ish (read: california creative) sandwiches. the best sandwich menu in the east bay, sorry!

name: taco's oscar
description: michelin bib taqueria. inventive tacos with housemade tortillas & a shipping container ambiance in the back. always a line, always worth it.

name: umami mart
description: japanese kitchen & barware shop; sake. shochu & imported tools for your home bar. yoko & kayoko know what they're doing and are on this earth to educate those around them.
pro tip: as the snack wizard herself always said, the best bar in the east bay that closes before 7.

name: joodooboo
description: banchan shop & tofu house. housemade dooboo (korean tofu) & seasonal veggie sides that change daily. steve is the man and dedicated whole-heartedly to feeding this city.

name: eli's mile high club
description: legendary dive bar & venue. live music, djs, & cravable shitty food all in a decrepit courtyard, but in a good way. tecate tall boys.
address: 3629 Martin Luther King Jr Way, Oakland, CA 94609
pro tip: don't leave shit in your car.

name: chapel of the chimes
description: historic 1909 columbarium & crematory. labyrinthine halls & spanish gothic architecture. bring a book or hard thoughts or a first date.

name: ebiko
description: takeout-only (but high quality). sushi & chirashi bowls. top-notch fish from tokyo markets. my favorite business model in the east bay.

name: piedmont springs
description: private outdoor hot tubs, sauna & steam room. not a lot of same-day spots fyi.

name: dracena quarry park
description: hidden neighborhood park carved from an old quarry. shady benches & play area for kids. lot's of grass for those of us that miss that.

name: june's pizza
description: cult-favorite wood-fired pizzas. if there's truly good pizza in the east bay (i'm skeptical), this is where it's at. back in the day, craig was throwing doughs out of a shipping container a few blocks away -- the vibes were dope, but the vibes are even better now.
tags: restaurant, pizza, cool space, the spot
pro tip: if the restaurant is full, grab a pie and head next door to brix brewery.

name: the taco panzon
description: west oakland food sleeper hit of a food truck. the carnitas buritto is up there on my top list of all time. marta is often throwing it down alone in there, so tip well. the best days of the week, she parks outside of ghost town brewery fyi!
pro tip: psst. you can call ahead with your order.

name: soba ichi
description: handmade soba noodle shop. cold seiro with dipping sauce & tempura, plus sake overflow. simple and perfect.

name: ghost town brewing
description: metal west oakland brewery & taproom. good beer.
pro tip: plan your visit around tacos panzon (food truck) being there. the carnitas burrito + salsa verde.

name: the new parkway theater
description: community cinema & pub. couches instead of stadium seating and better programming than surrounding theaters.

name: lovely's
description: smashburgers. outdoor seating + a brewery if you're thirsty.

name: world famous hotboys
description: hot chicken sandwich joint. take them seriously about their spice levels.
pro tip: they're serious about their spice.

name: popoca
description: live-fire salvadoran restaurant. wood-fired pupusas (that reinvent the game). tasty cocktails.

name: narrative
description: vintage & concept store mixing gallery vibes from a collective of curators. clothing, home goods & rad art shows.

name: oakland museum of california
description: truly a smangin' museum. california art, history & science under one roof. interactive galleries & community events.
pro tip: friday night concerts are particularly fun with kids in tow.

name: tacos mi rancho
description: iconic taco truck: for the drunk kids of oakland. expect your tacos wet with sauce.
pro tip: cash only -- at least it was back when i was a drunk kid in oakland. maybe they take venmo now.

name: champa garden
description: lao-thai-cambodian comfort food. crispy rice salad & pumpkin curry worth the wait.

name: grand lake theater
description: historic 1926 movie palace with neon marquee & wurlitzer organ. the best screen to see a film you want to care about.

name: walden pond books
description: grand avenue's chillest indie bookstore. new & used books piled high and deep. great used prices.

name: ordinaire
description: og natural wine bar & shop. up there cheese program. organic, zero-intervention bottles all over the place.
pro tip: this is the place to grab a bottle for the lake -- don't let anyone tell you otherwise.

name: vientian cafe
description: suuuper casual lao-thai-viet spot. lemongrass sausage, papaya salad & sticky rice.
pro tip: the steam fish cake.

name: taqueria el paisa
description: all the steeze at this mexican joint. very fun space. killer saudadero & birria tacos.
pro tip: i respect the spice level here.

name: fikscue craft bbq
description: indo‑tex halal barbecue. smoked brisket, satay & indonesian sides. worth it.

name: alameda flea
description: massive first-sunday antiques fair with 800+ dealers. sunrise picking & deals.
pro tip: getting there early is 100% worth the lack of sleep.

name: trader vic's
description: legendary tiki bar & restaurant on the emeryville marina. hot, cheesy aura.

name: enssaro
description: my personal favorite ethiopian spot. sourdough injera and all the fixings.

name: gangnam tofu
description: korean tofu house: bubbling sundubu jjigae & banchan. small, no frills. the fried chicken, though.
address: 11740 San Pablo Ave Suite C, El Cerrito, CA 94530

name: great china
description: berkeley institution for peking duck & 'double skin' noodles. truly special, extensive wine list.

name: sfizio
description: neighborhood italian eatery. handmade, handmade pasta, seasonal salads & spritzes. order at the counter. i have so much respect for the matt is able to keep prices down and the quality high for the community.

name: sirene
description: seafood & fried chicken bistro. such a good add to the lake. creative crudos & natural wine.
pro tip: chartreuse, always.

name: year of the snake
description: sunday-only *funky rustic pastry* pop-up at morell's bread. egg tarts are the best in the east bay.

name: cellarmaker brewing
description: craft brewery & taproom. the hazy pilsners are the move.

name: poppy bagels
description: small-batch bagelry making chewy montreal-style bagels in a sun-filled space. the block is hot.

name: johansson projects
description: contemporary gallery showing emerging & established artists. fun openings & good people.

name: part 2 gallery
description: eclectic gallery hosting rotating exhibitions & community events. lots of new stuff, constantly.

name: berkeley rose garden
description: historic terraced rose garden with 250+ rose varieties. hillside amphitheater & bay views. good for kids or first dates. for my tennis players, don't steal my court.

name: solano cellars
description: cozy hideaway on solano. wine shop & bar with well-curated bottles and flights. everyone who works here knows their shit and has great taste.

name: vintage berkeley
description: neighborhood wine shop with small-producer bottles & frequent tastings. serious but unpretentious.

name: couchdate
description: newly reimagined afro indo market with fancy teas and antique rugs. old books and curated sounds.

name: oakland vintage market
description: good finds, outside. once a month, so check the schedule.

name: sibley volcanic preserve
description: lovelty flatish hike. lot's of sun. nice views to the east and west.

name: briones -- springhill road trailhead
description: trying not to give toooooo many of my top favorite hikes away because i like to be alone, but - although quite vertical - this one's a secret favorite with killer views of diablo & the east bay.

name: telegraph estate vintage market
description: reletively new addition to the west oakland thrift game. good finds.

name: chappell hayes observation tower
description: you got to appreciate a little grunge to appreciate this park, but i love to drag folks out to this corner of west oakland for a walk + view. best view of the port.

name: cesar chavez
description: windy picnic spot. lovely views of the city. bring a dog or a kite or a shotgot to shoot at drones.

name: the study wine bar
description: epicenter for funky shtuff run by noel and barrie -- both of whom are mayoral figures of the area. sleeper hits and super fun wines. a lot of 00 stuff.

name: archery range
description: free archery range (+donation) if you have a bow, arrows, & a bycock hat. they have a golf course like set up for archery. pretty fun.

name: emilia's pizzeria
description: one man opperation throwing made-to-order pizzas cut into 8 unequal slices. don't sleep on it.

name: montclair driving range
description: we can all agree that golf is stupid. HOWEVER, there are pitchers of cheap beer here and you can go with other non-golf people and have a very fun time.

name: redwood bowl staging area
description: west ridge trail > chown > french > redwood peak trail. that's the move.

name: bombera
description: big, bangin' space dedicated to fire and the collision of mexico and california. michelin bib = good value for quality -- (this time they're right).

name: oken
description: albert gets down to business (of Ok's deli fame). playful/casual/contemporary korean/japanese.

name: bar panisse
description: chez panisse's little sister, but i'd rather be there any day of the week. refreshingly fresh. nothing is mindblowing, but everything is perfect.

name: cafe brusco
description: good coffee, truly yes; and in a neck of the woods that needs more of it. But this is really on the list because they carry Good Luck Bakery pastries which will one day take over the east bay.
